sources: Florida Fish and Wildlife Conservation Commission (FWC)
California Department of Fish and Wildlife (CDFW)
North Carolina Wildlife Resources Commission & Division of Marine Fisheries
Louisiana Department of Wildlife and Fisheries (LDWF)
Alaska Department of Fish and Game (ADFG)
notes: Regulations are subject to change. Always verify with official state agencies before fishing.
Federal waters regulations may differ from state waters.
Some regulations vary by geographic sub-regions within states.
Emergency orders and proclamations may supersede published regulations.

license_requirements.freshwater: Basic freshwater fishing license required for residents age 16+ and non-residents
license_requirements.saltwater: Saltwater fishing license required for residents age 16+ and non-residents
license_requirements.notes: State waters extend from shore to 3 miles in Atlantic, 9 miles in Gulf of Mexico

species.bag_limit_notes: 2 per person in Gulf state and federal waters; 1 per person in Atlantic federal waters
species.season_closed: Atlantic harvest currently closed; NOAA announces Atlantic season annually. Gulf season typically ~60 days starting in June
species.special_regulations: Season dates announced annually; Atlantic season determined by NOAA
species.geographic_restrictions: Different regulations for Gulf vs Atlantic waters

species.bag_limit_notes: Within 3-grouper aggregate bag limit
species.special_regulations: Zero bag limit for captain and crew of for-hire vessels in Gulf
species.geographic_restrictions: Gulf vs Atlantic have different seasons

species.bag_limit_notes: Within 3-grouper aggregate bag limit
species.special_regulations: Zero bag limit for captain and crew of for-hire vessels in Gulf
species.geographic_restrictions: Different closures for Atlantic federal waters

species.bag_limit_notes: Within 3-grouper aggregate bag limit
species.special_regulations: Zero bag limit for captain and crew of for-hire vessels in Gulf
species.geographic_restrictions: Atlantic only

species.minimum_size_notes: Fork length in Atlantic; no minimum in Gulf
species.bag_limit_notes: 5 per person, 30 per vessel in Atlantic state waters; higher limits may apply in Gulf
species.special_regulations: Captain and crew bag limits prohibited statewide on for-hire vessels
species.geographic_restrictions: Different size limits for Atlantic vs Gulf

species.bag_limit_notes: Regional bag limits vary; possession of one fish over 19 inches allowed
species.special_regulations: One fish over 19 inches per vessel (or per person if shore fishing) included in bag limit
species.geographic_restrictions: Regional variations throughout state

species.bag_limit_notes: Regional variations; catch-and-release only in Indian River Lagoon
species.season_closed: Closed in Indian River Lagoon (catch-and-release only)
species.special_regulations: Slot limit; harvest prohibited in Indian River Lagoon
species.geographic_restrictions: Multiple management regions with different limits

species.bag_limit_notes: 5 black bass total (all Micropterus species combined), only 1 may be 16 inches or longer
species.special_regulations: TrophyCatch program allows temporary possession over limits for documentation. State record submissions allowed.
species.geographic_restrictions: Special regulations on some water bodies

species.bag_limit_notes: Applies to Suwannee River system
species.special_regulations: Specific to Suwannee River system
species.geographic_restrictions: Suwannee River system only

species.bag_limit_notes: Subject to Atlantic-wide management
species.special_regulations: Atlantic States Marine Fisheries Commission coordination
species.geographic_restrictions: Atlantic coast

species.bag_limit_notes: Check FWC regulations for specific limits
species.special_regulations: Species-specific regulations apply
species.geographic_restrictions: Regional variations

license_requirements.saltwater: Saltwater fishing license required for age 17+ in saltwater
license_requirements.notes: Regulations valid September 1, 2025 through August 31, 2026. Possession limit equals double the bag limit unless otherwise noted.

species.minimum_size_notes: 15 inches in state waters; 16 inches in federal waters when open
species.bag_limit_notes: 4 per person in state waters year-round; 2 per person in federal waters when open
species.season_open: Year-round in state waters; May 22 in federal waters
species.special_regulations: Circle hooks required. Federal season may close if quota reached.
species.geographic_restrictions: State waters (0-9 nautical miles) vs federal waters

species.bag_limit_notes: 3 per day within slot limit. One oversized fish (28+ inches) allowed with special tag per license year.
species.special_regulations: Slot limit: 15-20 inches. Oversized Spotted Seatrout Tag and Bonus Tag system for fish over 28 inches.
species.geographic_restrictions: Statewide

species.bag_limit_notes: 5 fish combined of largemouth, smallmouth, Alabama, Guadalupe, and spotted bass
species.special_regulations: Some water bodies have different regulations (check Exceptions to Statewide Regulations)
species.geographic_restrictions: Statewide with exceptions on specific water bodies

species.bag_limit_notes: 5 fish combined of largemouth, smallmouth, Alabama, Guadalupe, and spotted bass
species.special_regulations: Combined bag limit with other black bass species
species.geographic_restrictions: Statewide

license_requirements.freshwater: Sport fishing license required for age 16+
license_requirements.saltwater: Sport fishing license required for age 16+ for ocean fishing
license_requirements.notes: Steelhead Report Card ($10.29) required for steelhead in anadromous waters. North Coast Salmon Report Card ($9.21) required for salmon in Klamath, Trinity, and Smith rivers.

species.bag_limit_notes: 10 total Rockfish, Cabezon, and Greenling in aggregate. 2-fish sub-bag limit for Canary Rockfish.
species.special_regulations: Bronzespotted, Cowcod, Quillback, and Yelloweye Rockfish may not be taken or possessed at any time. Always check for in-season changes.
species.geographic_restrictions: Varies by management area

species.minimum_size_notes: Varies by water body; 12 inches for most lakes and Delta
species.bag_limit_notes: Possession limit of 10
species.season_open: Year-round for lakes and reservoirs; April 25 for streams/rivers
species.special_regulations: Specific regulations vary by water body. Check special regulations for location.
species.geographic_restrictions: Different seasons for lakes/reservoirs vs streams/rivers

species.bag_limit_notes: Steelhead Report Card required. Only hatchery steelhead (adipose fin clipped) may be retained in many waters; wild steelhead must be released.
species.special_regulations: Steelhead defined as rainbow trout >16 inches in anadromous waters. Wild fish (intact adipose fin) must be released in many areas.
species.geographic_restrictions: Specific regulations for each anadromous water system

species.bag_limit_notes: North Coast Salmon Report Card required for Klamath, Trinity, Smith rivers. Ocean salmon seasons announced annually in April.
species.special_regulations: Specific season dates and harvest guidelines released annually after population assessments
species.geographic_restrictions: Different regulations for ocean vs river systems

species.bag_limit_notes: Statewide daily bag limit; check for specific water body exceptions
species.special_regulations: Check specific regulations for each water body
species.geographic_restrictions: Varies by water body

license_requirements.freshwater: Inland fishing license required for age 16+
license_requirements.saltwater: Coastal recreational fishing license required for age 16+
license_requirements.notes: Coastal regulations effective January 26, 2026. Inland regulations effective August 1, 2025 to July 31, 2026. Size and creel limits in inland waters match adjacent coastal/joint waters.

species.minimum_size_notes: Atlantic Ocean: 28-31 inch slot limit. Inland: 18 inch minimum.
species.bag_limit_notes: 1 per person per day in Atlantic Ocean. Closed in Albemarle Sound and Central Southern Management Areas.
species.season_open: Year-round in Atlantic Ocean; May 1 in some inland areas
species.season_closed: May 1 - September 30 in Albemarle Sound Striped Bass Management Area joint waters. Closed in Albemarle Sound and Central Southern Management Areas.
species.special_regulations: Harvest slot limit in Atlantic. Gigging, spearing, or gaffing prohibited. Closed in multiple management areas.
species.geographic_restrictions: Multiple management areas with different regulations

species.bag_limit_notes: 5 fish for private anglers; 7 fish for for-hire anglers
species.special_regulations: Bag limit increase effective January 1, 2026 based on improved stock assessment
species.geographic_restrictions: Coastal fishing waters and joint fishing waters

species.bag_limit_notes: 1 per person per day during open season
species.special_regulations: Two separate open seasons. Internal Coastal and Joint Fishing Waters.
species.geographic_restrictions: Internal Coastal and Joint Fishing Waters

species.bag_limit_notes: 1 per person per day during brief open season
species.special_regulations: Very limited season. Harvest must be reported at deq.nc.gov/report-my-fish (effective December 1, 2025)
species.geographic_restrictions: Internal Coastal and Joint Fishing Waters

license_requirements.freshwater: Basic Fishing License required for age 18+ for freshwater species
license_requirements.saltwater: Saltwater License required for age 18+ for areas south of saltwater line
license_requirements.notes: Both licenses may be required depending on location. Contact LDWF at 225-765-2898 for specific requirements.

species.bag_limit_notes: 15 per person; no more than 2 fish over 25 inches can be retained. New regulations (13-20 inch slot, 2 over 20 inches) effective November 20.
species.special_regulations: Size and bag limit changes went into effect November 20. Only 2 fish over 25 inches (or 20 inches under new rules) allowed.
species.geographic_restrictions: Statewide in saltwater
species.effective_dates: Current regulations; new regulations effective November 20, 2025

species.bag_limit_notes: 4 fish per person within slot limit
species.special_regulations: Slot limit: 16-27 inches total length. Retention over maximum prohibited.
species.geographic_restrictions: South of Louisiana saltwater line

license_requirements.freshwater: Sport fishing license required for age 16+
license_requirements.saltwater: Sport fishing license required for age 16+
license_requirements.notes: Regulations vary significantly by drainage and management area. Emergency Orders (EOs) supersede published regulations - check before fishing.

species.bag_limit_notes: 1 per day for residents (Southeast/Yakutat). Limits vary by region and residency.
species.special_regulations: Specific to Southeast Alaska and Yakutat. Check area-specific regulations.
species.geographic_restrictions: Regulations vary significantly by region and drainage

species.bag_limit_notes: General limit; varies by species, location, and residency status
species.special_regulations: Each drainage has specific regulations. Emergency Orders frequently issued.
species.geographic_restrictions: Highly variable by region

species.bag_limit_notes: Nonresidents: 1 daily; varies by charter vs unguided. Charter vessels in Homer: 2 daily (1 any size, 1 under 27 inches).
species.special_regulations: International Pacific Halibut Commission (IPHC) regulations. Daily limits remained same for 2026 unguided sectors.
species.geographic_restrictions: Limits vary by management unit (e.g., Homer has different charter limits)

species.bag_limit_notes: Nonresidents: 6 per day. Pelagic rockfish in Southeast: 5 daily, 10 possession in some areas.
species.special_regulations: Pelagic rockfish regulations vary by area (Petersburg, Wrangell, Kake areas)
species.geographic_restrictions: Regional variations

species.bag_limit_notes: 1 per day, 1 in possession. Annual limit: 2 fish (1 at 30-35 inches, 1 at 55+ inches).
species.special_regulations: Slot limit with option for one trophy fish. Annual limit of 2 fish with size requirements.
species.geographic_restrictions: Statewide

multi_state_federal_species.minimum_size_notes: Lower-jaw fork length in federal waters
multi_state_federal_species.bag_limit_notes: No daily limit, but 250 fish per vessel per year combined for blue marlin, white marlin, and roundscale spearfish
multi_state_federal_species.special_regulations: HMS Angling or HMS Charterboat/Headboat permit required. Cannot retain if hammerhead or oceanic whitetip shark on board.
multi_state_federal_species.geographic_restrictions: Atlantic Ocean and Gulf of Mexico federal waters

multi_state_federal_species.bag_limit_notes: No daily limit, but 250 fish per vessel per year combined with blue marlin and roundscale spearfish
multi_state_federal_species.special_regulations: HMS permit required. Cannot retain if hammerhead or oceanic whitetip shark on board.
multi_state_federal_species.geographic_restrictions: Atlantic Ocean and Gulf of Mexico federal waters

multi_state_federal_species.special_regulations: HMS permit required. Cannot retain if hammerhead or oceanic whitetip shark on board.
multi_state_federal_species.geographic_restrictions: Atlantic Ocean and Gulf of Mexico federal waters

multi_state_federal_species.bag_limit_notes: 3 per angler per day or trip
multi_state_federal_species.special_regulations: HMS permit required. Must be landed with tail and one pectoral fin attached.
multi_state_federal_species.geographic_restrictions: Atlantic Ocean and Gulf of Mexico federal waters

multi_state_federal_species.special_regulations: Does not require HMS permit (unlike other HMS species)
multi_state_federal_species.geographic_restrictions: Atlantic Ocean and Gulf of Mexico

multi_state_federal_species.minimum_size_notes: Varies significantly by state and water body. 15 inches in Michigan Lake Erie.
multi_state_federal_species.bag_limit_notes: Varies by state and water body. Michigan Lake Erie: 6 through April 30, 2026. Wisconsin: 5 total daily with ability to fish two bodies of water with 3-fish limits.
multi_state_federal_species.season_open: Variable by state and water body
multi_state_federal_species.season_closed: Variable by state and water body
multi_state_federal_species.special_regulations: Great Lakes states have widely varying regulations including slot limits. Check specific state and water body regulations.
multi_state_federal_species.geographic_restrictions: Regulations vary dramatically between states and individual lakes

data_gaps: Not all 50 states + DC + territories were researched due to time constraints
Scientific names not available for all species
Some states have complex regional variations not fully captured
Seasonal dates may be announced closer to season start
Federal waters regulations (3-200 miles offshore) may differ from state waters
Some freshwater species (catfish, crappie, pike) have limited data
recommendations: Always verify current regulations before fishing
Check for emergency orders and proclamations
Download state-specific fishing apps (Fish Rules, state agency apps)
Consider charter/for-hire vs private angler differences
Be aware of protected species and no-take zones
Understand proper measurement techniques (total length vs fork length)
Know the difference between bag limits, possession limits, and vessel limits
next_steps: Add remaining 44 states + DC + territories (Puerto Rico, US Virgin Islands, Guam, American Samoa, Northern Mariana Islands)
Add more freshwater species (catfish species, crappie, pike, muskie, panfish)
Add more saltwater species by region
Include protected species and catch-and-release only species
Add information about fishing methods restrictions
Add contact information for each state agency
Include links to official regulation documents
Add information about federal waters (EEZ) vs state waters boundaries
